text: The Very Best of Kiss is a compilation album by the American rock band Kiss. It was released on August 27, 2002. It contains 21 of the band's most popular tracks, all previously released. ==Track listing== ==Personnel== *Paul Stanley – rhythm guitar (1-13,15,17-21), lead vocals (1,3–5,7–8,10,13,15,17,19–21), guitar solo (5), first guitar solo on (10,13), bass guitar (15,17) *Gene Simmons – bass guitar (1-14,18-19,21), rhythm guitar (14), lead vocals (2,6,8,11,14,18,21) *Ace Frehley – lead guitar (1–17); rhythm guitar and bass guitar (16), lead vocals (16) *Peter Criss – drums (1–15), lead vocals (9,12) *Eric Carr – drums (18–20), backing vocals (21) *Vinnie Vincent – lead guitar (18-19) *Bruce Kulick – lead guitar (20–21), bass guitar and acoustic guitar solo (20) *Eric Singer – drums (21) *Anton Fig – drums (16–17) Not credited, but do appear: *Dick Wagner – acoustic guitar (9). *Bob Ezrin – keyboards (9) *Vini Poncia – keyboards and backing vocals (17) *Eddie Kramer — keyboards (13-15) *Phil Ashley - keyboards (20) ==Charts== {| class="wikitable" |- !Chart (2002) !Peak position |- |Finland's Official List | style="text-align:center;"|25 |- |Top 100 Mexico | style="text-align:center;"|94 |- |Norway Album Chart | style="text-align:center;"|16 |- |Sweden Albums Top 60 | style="text- align:center;"|30 |- |US Billboard 200 | style="text-align:center;"|52 |- |US Top Hard Rock Albums | style="text-align:center;"|22 |- |US Top Pop Catalog | style="text-align:center;"|29 |} The album has sold over 800,000 copies in the U.S, according to the Nielson Soundscan, and has been certified gold. ==Certifications== ==References== Category:Kiss (band) compilation albums Category:2002 greatest hits albums Category:Mercury Records compilation albums Category:Island Records compilation albums Category:Universal Music Group compilation albums
